3. City Secretary

City Secretary
==============

The City Secretary's Office is a vital component of the City of Ferris, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements and providing essential administrative support to the City Council and the public. The City Secretary serves as the official custodian of city records and is responsible for maintaining transparency and accessibility in municipal operations. In the City of Ferris, the City Secretary also serves as the Executive Assistant for the City Manager's Office. Through efficient and effective operations, these roles have been combined to save taxpayers money.

* Record Keeping: Managing and preserving all official city records, including ordinances, resolutions, minutes, contracts, and other important documents.
* Meeting Coordination: Preparing agendas, posting notices, and recording minutes for City Council meetings and other official gatherings.
* Compliance and Transparency: Ensuring the city's adherence to state and local laws regarding open meetings, public records, and other statutory requirements.
* Executive Support:
  Providing administrative support to the City Manager's Office, enhancing the efficiency of city operations and contributing to cost savings.

The City Secretary works closely with the City Council, City Manager, and other departments to promote effective governance and public trust.

### [FAQs](https://www.ferristexas.gov/Faq.aspx?TID=18)

[What is the role of the City Secretary?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/159/City-Secretary#)
:   The City Secretary is responsible for maintaining official city records, overseeing municipal elections, responding to public information requests, coordinating City Council meetings, and ensuring compliance with statutory requirements. In Ferris, the City Secretary also serves as the Executive Assistant for the City Manager’s Office.

[How can I contact the City Secretary’s Office?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/159/City-Secretary#)
:   You can contact the City Secretary's Office by calling 972-544-2110 or
    [emailing the City Secretary](mailto:krystinarodriguez@ferristexas.gov)
    . For in-person visits, the office is located at 114 S Central Street, Ferris, TX 75125.

[How does the City Secretary ensure fair and transparent elections?](https://www.ferristexas.gov/159/City-Secretary#)
:   The City Secretary oversees the administration of municipal elections, ensuring they are conducted in compliance with state and local laws, and that all procedures are transparent and accessible to the public.
